channel.title: Seeds of discontent
channel.description:
Documentary series addressing: race relations, civil rights, poverty, youth, crime, deliquency. Host: Hartford Smith, Jr., Michigan Dept of Social Services and Wayne State U. This prog.: Smith visits a "hippie pad" and explores communal living.

An online collection of early educational public radio content from the National Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB).

item.title: Program 11 of 26
item.description: For series info, see Item 3313 and 3314. This prog.: Problems of the Negro in general society are discussed by Odetta, Leslie Grinage and Dick Gregory.
item.dc:creator: Wayne State University
item.dc:subject: Info.-Orient.

item.title: Program 21 of 26
item.description: For series info, see Item 3313 and 3314. This prog.: Campus unrest, student demonstrations. The growing discontent and rebellion of college students. Interviews with student activists at Wayne State U. who are in conflict with "the establishment."
item.dc:creator: Wayne State University
item.dc:subject: Info.-Orient.

item.title: Program 9 of 26
item.description: For series info, see Item 3313 and 3314. This prog.: Negro folk artist Odetta looks at her experiences, problems and concerns; in so doing she describes the problem of the Negro in becoming established in the entertainment world.
item.dc:creator: Wayne State University
item.dc:subject: Info.-Orient.

item.title: Program 10 of 26
item.description: For series info, see Item 3313 and 3314. This prog.: Negro bassist Leslie Grinage gives an inside look at the problems facing Negro performers.
item.dc:creator: Wayne State University
item.dc:subject: Info.-Orient.

item.title: Program 26 of 26
item.description: For series info, see Item 3313 and 3314. This prog.: Hartford Smith, Jr.'s, observations, comments and conclusions regarding the nature and meaning of discontent in American society, and what needs to be done.
item.dc:creator: Wayne State University
item.dc:subject: Info.-Orient.

item.title: Program 23 of 26
item.description: For series info, see Items3313-14. This prog.: An assessment of the attitudes and reactions of established agencies and institutions as reflected by their programs in response to urban society's unrest and discontent. United Community Services of Detroit.
item.dc:creator: Wayne State University
item.dc:subject: Info.-Orient.

item.title: Program 25 of 26
item.description: For series info, see Item 3313 and 3314. This prog.: Assessment of the response, attitude and action by the Michigan State Legislature in the aftermath of the Detroit riots of 1967.
item.dc:creator: Wayne State University
item.dc:subject: Info.-Orient.

item.title: Program 24 of 26
item.description: For series info, see Item 3313 and 3314. This prog.: Assessment of the response, attitude and relevancyof Detroit's Poverty Program, including an interview with the director.
item.dc:creator: Wayne State University
item.dc:subject: Info.-Orient.

item.title: Program 15 of 26
item.description: For series info, see Item 3313 and 3314. This prog.: Interviews with Negro professionals and middle class members: psychologist, newspaper editor, car salesman.
item.dc:creator: Wayne State University
item.dc:subject: Info.-Orient.

item.title: Program 20 of 26
item.description: For series info, see Item 3313 and 3314. This prog.: Campus unrest, student demonstrations. The growing discontent and rebellion of college students. Interviews with student activists at Wayne State U. who are in conflict with "the establishment."
item.dc:creator: Wayne State University
item.dc:subject: Info.-Orient.

item.title: Program 13 of 26
item.description: For series info, see Item 3313 and 3314. This prog.: Political and social attitudes of the Negro professional man.
item.dc:creator: Wayne State University
item.dc:subject: Info.-Orient.

item.title: Program 17 of 26
item.description: For series info, see Item 3313 and 3314. This prog.: The American Negro and public education, as a source of both hope and frustration. Addresses serious problems confronting present day school systems in large metropolitan areas.
item.dc:creator: Wayne State University
item.dc:subject: Info.-Orient.

item.title: Program 22 of 26
item.description: For series info, see Item 3313 and 3314. This prog.: Growing discontent and militancy among public school teachers. Features interviews with teachers from the inner city schools of Detroit.
item.dc:creator: Wayne State University
item.dc:subject: Info.-Orient.

item.title: Program 19 of 26
item.description: For series info, see Item 3313 and 3314. This prog.: Looking at the future through the eyes of Negro children attending two predominantly black junior high schools bordering on the two largest housing projects in Detroit.
item.dc:creator: Wayne State University
item.dc:subject: Info.-Orient.

item.title: Program 5 of 26
item.description: For series info, see Item 3313 and 3314. This prog.: Feelings and attitudes about contemporary welfare systems. See also programs #3 and #4.
item.dc:creator: Wayne State University
item.dc:subject: Info.-Orient.

item.title: Program 4 of 26
item.description: For series info, see Item 3313 and 3314. This prog.: As previous program (#3) but centering this time around medical care and effects of poverty on various ethnic groups such as poor Negroes and southern whites.
item.dc:creator: Wayne State University
item.dc:subject: Info.-Orient.

item.title: Program 6 of 26
item.description: For series info, see Items3313-14.This prog.: Historical perspective on problems of the Negro. A group of older Negro men, residents of Detroit upwards of 40 years, describe why the Negro left the South, what he was looking for and what he found in north.
item.dc:creator: Wayne State University
item.dc:subject: Info.-Orient.

item.title: Program 3 of 26
item.description: For series info, see Item 3313 and 3314. This prog.: Poverty stricken citizens in the inner city of Detroit discuss problems of shelter, food, clothing and recreation; they discuss plight of the poor, their hopes and disappointments.
item.dc:creator: Wayne State University
item.dc:subject: Info.-Orient.

item.title: Program 12 of 26
item.description: For series info, see Item 3313 and 3314. This prog.: Guests: Odetta, Dick Gregory, Leslie Grinage on what should be done in entertainment field.
item.dc:creator: Wayne State University
item.dc:subject: Info.-Orient.

item.title: Program 14 of 26
item.description: For series info, see Item 3313 and 3314. This prog.: Interviews with Negro professionals and middle class members: psychologist, newspaper editor, car salesman.
item.dc:creator: Wayne State University
item.dc:subject: Info.-Orient.

item.title: Program 16 of 26
item.description: For series info, see Item 3313 and 3314. This prog.: The American Negro and public education, as a source of both hope and frustration. Addresses serious problems confronting present day school systems in large metropolitan areas.
item.dc:creator: Wayne State University
item.dc:subject: Info.-Orient.

item.title: Program 7 of 26
item.description: For series info, see Item 3313 and 3314. This prog.: See also program #6. Older Negro men talk about Negro-police relationships, the riots, red-light districts, and the Negro community.
item.dc:creator: Wayne State University
item.dc:subject: Info.-Orient.

item.title: Program 2 of 26
item.description: Documentary series addressing: race relations, civil rights, poverty, youth, crime, deliquency. Host: Hartford Smith, Jr., Michigan Dept of Social Services and Wayne State U. This prog.: Smith visits a "hippie pad" and explores communal living.
item.dc:creator: Wayne State University
item.dc:subject: Info.-Orient.

item.title: Program 18 of 26
item.description: For series info, see Item 3313 and 3314. This prog.: The emergency of black self-help groups in Negro ghettos. A look at current crises and needs in urban centers throughout the nation.
item.dc:creator: Wayne State University
item.dc:subject: Info.-Orient.

item.title: Program 8 of 26
item.description: For series info, see Item 3313 and 3314. This prog.: See also program #6 and #7. Continuation of same discussions: Negro-police relationships, the riots, red-light districts, and the Negro community.
item.dc:creator: Wayne State University
item.dc:subject: Info.-Orient.
